channel.description: This is retarded and a pain in the ass when you misspell your query, remove it.

item.title: Your last search was less than 5 seconds ago. Please try again later
item.dc:creator: @BAsh BAsh
item.description:
@BAsh wrote:

[quote=“casey., post:1, topic:337406”]yo while your at it lessin report times.

80 seconds a report is to long, what if you reportin a whole thread of spam.
And after you report it brings you back to the board, annoying.[/quote]
Surely there is a description to go with the report. Just say that a moderator should check the thread out. Start with the first spam post.

If you give them a dozen spam reports for something that they can just scroll down for I’m sure they’ll be pissed.

Read full topic

item.title: Your last search was less than 5 seconds ago. Please try again later
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

mwiebelhaus:

Heres a problem that has been a problem since this forum was created. When you search for something while logged out it requires you to login, once you login the damn thing lies to you and tells you that you forgot to put something in.

That is probably because it starts a new session once you log in, and doesn’t forward the post variables. I don’t know if it’s such a problem though, also I’ve been thinking about opening search up to guests, so then it would be avoided as well.

Read full topic

item.title: Your last search was less than 5 seconds ago. Please try again later
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

I used misspelling as an excuse to post the thread because the full explanation is long and boring and I expected you to just change it (Silly, that).

Full explanation follows:

It’s not because I misspell things; it’s because I use the search for - of all things - searching for posts. They’re posts that I’ve read, and usually are relevant to the conversation at hand, so I know the author, the approximate length, usually the thread it was posted in and some keywords. So when I see the results and find that none of the results come close (Which usually takes less than a second, and less than that when there are no results), I rework the query until it’s returned. Usually this takes 3-4 tries, and reworking the query is usually fast (Adding or deleting a single word), thence ariseth this thread.

So yeah, I’ll see how it goes with 2 seconds and append more bitching here if necessary.

Read full topic
item.source: Your last search was less than 5 seconds ago. Please try again later

item.title: Your last search was less than 5 seconds ago. Please try again later
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Eh Pretty Easy:

P.S. Some forums have a waiting period of 30 seconds!

If this forum still ran a MySQL query for every search it would have to be at least 30 seconds, and even then I’d probably have to have a dedicated server just to run the database server. Sphinx search speeds things up many, many times over, and even returns better results. It’s a life saver.

Javac, is 2 seconds a problem? Can you misspell and correct in less than that amount of time?

Read full topic

item.title: Your last search was less than 5 seconds ago. Please try again later
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:16, topic:336815”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=433232.msg3180986#msg3180986 date=1271295537]
How about after 3 attempts you impose a 5 second delay instead of the current 2 attempts. If you misspell something three times in a row you can use the five seconds to learn how to spell it properly moran.

BASIC USABILITY WITHOUT COMPROMISING SECURITY.
[/quote]

Good idea, but the only setting I can currently set is “Time required between searches from same user”. I’m going to set it down to 2, I don’t expect any problems, but if there are then I’ll have to adjust it again.

Tell me if you guys have problems with 2 seconds.[/quote]

you could always hard code it!

Read full topic

item.title: Your last search was less than 5 seconds ago. Please try again later
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Moparisthebest:

You don’t understand, of course I CAN remove it, but then anyone can spam the search as much as they want and make the server grind to a halt. It usually takes me at least 5 seconds to fix a misspelled query anyway.

If you believe that someone spamming your search is the weakest point in your forums impenetrable armor and that nothing may sway you to remove it, then I won’t waste time trying.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reaction_time:

Mean [Reaction Time] for college-age individuals is about 160 milliseconds to detect an auditory stimulus, and approximately 190 milliseconds to detect visual stimulus.

Is 0.19 seconds good enough for you?

Read full topic
